description: A creamy and aromatic Indian dish made with tender chicken cooked in a spiced yogurt and almond sauce.

steps.instruction: In a bowl, mix together the natural yogurt, ground almonds, coriander powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and chilli powder. Add the diced chicken to the bowl, coating it thoroughly with the yogurt mixture. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and saut√© until they begin to sizzle.
Add the chopped onion to the pan and cook until it turns golden brown, about 5-6 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and grated ginger to the pan, cooking for another 2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the marinated chicken and all its marinade to the pan. Cook for about 6-8 minutes until the chicken is sealed on all sides.
Pour in the coconut milk and stir well. Season with salt to taste.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and simmer for about 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
Garnish the chicken korma with fresh coriander leaves before serving. Enjoy with naan or basmati rice.
